frame.name: Locale_by_event
frame.definition:
<def-root>A place defined in terms of an event which occurred (or will occur) there. <ex><fex name="Locale">Woodstock, NY</fex> <m>was</m> the <t>site</t> <fex name="DefEvnt">of the most important rock concert of 1969</fex>.</ex> <ex><fex name="DefEvnt">Our</fex> <fex name="DefEvnt">meeting</fex> <t>site</t> was chosen for its solitude.</ex>
In the second example, the event FE is labeled with two labels, because the two words do not form a syntactic constituent; the first would be GF Genitive PT Possessive, and the second, GF Dependent and PT NP.</def-root>

FE.name: Locale
FE.definition:
<def-root>A stable bounded area. It is typically the denotation of the nouns in Locale_by_event, which will be annotated on the target word.
<ex>We need to find a suitable <t>venue</t> <fex name="DefEvnt">for such a large wedding</fex>.</ex> <ex><fex name="Locale">Tours</fex> <m>was</m> the <t>site</t> <fex name="DefEvnt">of the defeat of the Turks by the French</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Constituent_parts
FE.definition:
<def-root>Salient parts that make up a <fen>Locale</fen>.
<ex>We need a meeting <t>site</t> <fex name="Constituent_parts">with more computers</fex> .</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Relative_location
FE.definition:
<def-root>A place that a <fen>Locale</fen> is located with respect to.
<ex>The <t>site</t> <fex name="DefEvnt">of their first meeting</fex>, <fex name="rel">west of the Mississippi</fex>, has never been disclosed.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Defining_event
FE.definition: <def-root>The event for which the locale is known or is named <ex>The driver died at the <t>scene</t> <fex name="DefEvnt">of the accident</fex>.</ex> </def-root>

FE.name: Descriptor
FE.definition:
<def-root>The Descriptor is a temporary condition of the <fen>Locale</fen>.
<ex>The next day, the governor visited the <fex name="des">still-smoldering</fex> <t>site</t> <fex name="DefEvnt">of the fire</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Name
FE.definition: <def-root>The name of the locale. <ex>The <fex name="Name">Bonneville</fex> <t>site</t> has been a favorite of drivers for many years.</ex></def-root>

lexUnit.name: site.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: The place at which an event takes place; may be on any scale: the site of the factory, the instertion site of the hypodermic.

lexUnit.name: scene.n
lexUnit.definition: Denotes the place where something occured: the scene of the accident, of the fight. Not: "A scene of great beauty unfolded before them."

lexUnit.name: venue.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: The place where an event, typically large and organized such as a meeting or artistic performance, takes place

lexUnit.name: theater_((of_war)).n
lexUnit.definition: FN: a large region in which a part of a still larger war takes place.

lexUnit.name: field.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: An outdoor area in which some activity takes place, as in "Will this camera be sturdy enough to use in the field?"

lexUnit.name: battlefield.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: A location at which a battle between armed opponents takes place.
